meanings.sent1: The train repasses the same spot on its journey back.
meanings.sent2: The car repasses the same street on its way home.
meanings.sent3: The bird repasses the tree multiple times, forgetting where it left its nest.
meanings.sent4: Time repasses moments like a river flowing endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The river repasses the same bend, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.sent1: The book contains a chapter about the repasses of the main character.
meanings.sent2: The repasses of the melody in the song add depth to its composition.
meanings.sent3: The repasses of the joke made everyone laugh harder each time.
meanings.sent4: The repasses of the train through the tunnel echoed in the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The repasses of the seasons bring familiar changes to the landscape.

meanings.definition: To pass or go by again
meanings.sent1: The hiker repasses the same trail to enjoy the view once more.
meanings.sent2: The memories of childhood repasses through her mind like a movie reel.
meanings.sent3: The cat repasses the same mouse hole, hoping for a second chance at catching its prey.
meanings.sent4: The wind repasses through the leaves, creating a gentle rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The sun repasses over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: To pass again over or through
meanings.sent1: The painter repasses the canvas with a brush to add more details.
meanings.sent2: The car repasses the same bridge, feeling a sense of déjà vu.
meanings.sent3: The athlete repasses the finish line, breaking their own record.
meanings.sent4: The river repasses the rocks, smoothing them over time.
meanings.sent5: The wind repasses through the open window, carrying the scent of flowers.
